meanings.def: not anything; no single thing
examples: There was nothing in her bag.
There's nothing you can do to help.
The doctor said there was nothing wrong with me.
Nothing else matters to him apart from his job.
It cost us nothing to go in.
(British English) He's five foot nothing (= exactly five feet tall).

meanings.def: very little; something that is not at all important or interesting
examples: We did nothing at the weekend.
‘What's that in your pocket?’ ‘Oh, nothing.’
I know next to nothing (= almost nothing) about art.

meanings.def: to be a person for whom somebody has no feelings
examples: I used to love her but she's nothing to me any more.

meanings.def: to have no connection with somebody/something
examples: Get out! It's nothing to do with you (= you have no right to know about it).
That has nothing to do with what we're discussing.

meanings.def: without payment
examples: She's always trying to get something for nothing.

meanings.def: with no reward or result
examples: All that preparation was for nothing because the visit was cancelled.

meanings.def: to have much less of a particular quality than somebody/something
examples: I'm quite a fast worker, but I've got nothing on her!

meanings.def: to have no information that could show somebody to be guilty of something
used as a polite way of replying when somebody thanks you for doing something, to show that you were happy to do it
examples: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘It was nothing—I enjoyed it.’

meanings.def: for a very good reason
examples: Not for nothing was he called the king of rock and roll.

meanings.def: only; no more/less than
examples: Nothing but a miracle can save her now.
I want nothing but the best for my children.

meanings.def: extremely; very
examples: The trip was nothing if not varied.

meanings.def: used to emphasize how great or extreme something is
examples: It was nothing less than a disaster.

meanings.def: not at all like
examples: It looks nothing like a horse.

meanings.def: not nearly; not at all
examples: I had nothing like enough time to answer all the questions.

meanings.def: not a great amount of something; nothing of great value or importance
examples: There's nothing much in the fridge.
I got up late and did nothing much all day.

meanings.def: (it’s) very easy
examples: You'll soon learn. There's nothing to it really.

meanings.def: to be willing to do anything to get what you want, even if it is dishonest or wrong
examples: She’ll stop at nothing to make money.

meanings.def: romantic words
examples: to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

meanings.def: there is no other action to take except the one mentioned
examples: There was nothing else for it but to resign.

meanings.def: something is/was not true
examples: There was a rumour she was going to resign, but there was nothing in it.

meanings.def: used to say that you enjoy something very much
examples: There's nothing like a brisk walk on a cold day!

idioms.def: to be a person for whom somebody has no feelings
examples: I used to love her but she's nothing to me any more.

idioms.idiom: be/have nothing to do with somebody/something
idioms.def: to have no connection with somebody/something
examples: Get out! It's nothing to do with you (= you have no right to know about it).
That has nothing to do with what we're discussing.
She's always trying to get something for nothing.
All that preparation was for nothing because the visit was cancelled.

idioms.def: to have much less of a particular quality than somebody/something
examples: I'm quite a fast worker, but I've got nothing on her!

idioms.def: used as a polite way of replying when somebody thanks you for doing something, to show that you were happy to do it
examples: ‘Thanks for all your help.’ ‘It was nothing—I enjoyed it.’
Not for nothing was he called the king of rock and roll.
Nothing but a miracle can save her now.
I want nothing but the best for my children.
The trip was nothing if not varied.

idioms.def: used to emphasize how great or extreme something is
examples: It was nothing less than a disaster.
It looks nothing like a horse.
I had nothing like enough time to answer all the questions.

idioms.def: not a great amount of something; nothing of great value or importance
examples: There's nothing much in the fridge.
I got up late and did nothing much all day.
You'll soon learn. There's nothing to it really.

idioms.def: to be willing to do anything to get what you want, even if it is dishonest or wrong
examples: She’ll stop at nothing to make money.
to whisper sweet nothings in somebody’s ear

idioms.idiom: there is/was nothing (else) for it (but to do something)
idioms.def: there is no other action to take except the one mentioned
examples: There was nothing else for it but to resign.
There was a rumour she was going to resign, but there was nothing in it.

idioms.def: used to say that you enjoy something very much
examples: There's nothing like a brisk walk on a cold day!

related: Three Men in a Boat (To Say Nothing of the Dog!)
